section.title: Usage information
section.p: Audio objects are modeled on the HTML5 audio element.
Audio objects can be referenced by data, datakeyref, and nested . Nested enable extensive configuration of how the audio object is presented.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: When an audio object cannot be rendered in a meaningful way, processors SHOULD present the contents of the fallback element, if it is present.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: Behaviours such as auto-playing, looping, and muting are determined by child . When not specified, the behavior depends on the user agent.
